summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between federal prosecutors and a magistrate judge regarding the submission and review of an application for an additional search warrant in the Epstein investigation. The email discusses revisions to the warrant application to clarify the nature of seized evidence, specifically describing photographs as sexually suggestive images of young girls.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Moses, and she is the judicial officer who will review the warrant application. Her signature block appears at the end of the document.

persons.name: Judge Pitman
persons.context: Mentioned as an alternative judicial officer to whom the warrant application could be presented if not ready for review by Judge Moses that night.

connections.description: Both are U.S. Magistrate Judges in the Southern District of New York, referenced as judicial officers available to review the warrant application.

events.title: Submission of Revised Warrant Application
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney submits a revised application and proposed search warrant to Judge Moses. The revisions clarify that seized photographs include sexually suggestive images of young girls, not just nude/partially nude images.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning a warrant application in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation dated July 2019.
The warrant application describes seized evidence including photographs that are 'sexually suggestive photographs' of 'young girls'.
The correspondence indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI in the Southern District of New York on this investigative step.
The timing (July 2019) is shortly before Epstein's arrest on federal charges.
